questions.question: Control Unit
keywords: CPU component responsible for coordinating and managing the execution of instructions.

questions.question: Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU)
keywords: CPU component that performs arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, etc.) and logical operations (AND, OR, NOT).

questions.question: Registers
keywords: Small, high-speed storage locations within the CPU used for temporarily holding data and instructions during processing.

questions.question: Memory Data Register (MDR)
keywords: Register that stores data fetched from or to be written to memory.

questions.question: Memory Address Register (MAR)
keywords: Register that holds the memory address of the data or instruction that needs to be accessed from or stored to memory.

questions.question: Cache Memory
keywords: High-speed volatile memory located between the CPU and main memory, used to store frequently accessed data for faster processing.

questions.question: Program Counter (PC)
keywords: Register that keeps track of the memory address of the next instruction to be fetched and executed.

questions.question: Von Neumann architecture
keywords: A computer architecture where program instructions and data are stored in the same memory, and fetched and executed sequentially by a central processing unit.

questions.question: Bus
keywords: A communication pathway that allows data and instructions to be transferred between different components of a computer, like the CPU, memory, and peripherals.

questions.question: Input/Output (I/O) Unit
keywords: Component responsible for managing the communication between the CPU and external devices, facilitating data input and output.

questions.question: Clock Speed
keywords: The rate at which the CPU's clock generates pulses, determining the number of instructions it can execute per second.

questions.question: Registers
keywords: Small, high-speed storage locations within the CPU used for temporarily holding data and instructions during processing.

questions.question: Control Bus
keywords: A type of bus responsible for transmitting control signals between the CPU and other parts of the computer.

questions.question: Instruction Set
keywords: A collection of all the instructions that a CPU can execute, including their binary representations and corresponding operations.
